column4: I need some help installing the xfce flavor of ubuntu. I cant get it to install via the desktop CD
I have experence with debian so I know that all of my stuff is Linux compadible
maybe the cd is bad, you can check it with a self test that's on the cd menu. Or you could try the alternate cd with a text based installer.
I have done both, the CD is good and the text install has problems as well. I is somewhere in X but I cant figure out where.
hmmm, are you sure your ram is ok? memtest is also on the cd.
useally I have to swich from nv to vesa and install the nvidia propiraty drivers
it should be works fine with windows ( Not dual booting physicaly swaping a HD)

windows is more forgiving with bad ram, I would check it just to be sure let it run some hours best). On my husbands pc we could install windows, but nor kubuntu, weird errors, at the end it was one bad ram stick.
it also works with my debian on a seprate HD so I know every thing works. Im migrateing to umbunt because faster repo updates
hmmm... how far do you get with the install?
it completes but on reboot to new system I end up with a black screen that cycles monitor between On with a weird line pattern and standby on 1.5 min cycle
sorry if I wasnt as clear as I thought I was being it installs but something is wrong with display side of it.

ok, then I have one further suggestion. Another error we had (after replacing the bad ram) was that X didn't start, but the usplash screen didn't give the focus to kdm. We solved it by removing "splash" from the boot kernel options in /boot/grub/menu.lst
this doesn't sound exactly like your problem, though

its got to be an odd thing. I have a debian box with fluxbox + rox and its all nice an neat. I did it with tutorials and messing around with it. Im only going to ubuntu because I want faster repo updates. maybe I should just learn to compile from source and scratch the whole *bunut thing. what do you think?
I'd say don't give up yet ;) What about my suggestion about removing splash in the boot options?
ill give it a shot and come back if it dosent work
